title: Role of a TonB-dependent receptor and an oxygenase in iron-dependent copper resistance in
authors: Cherry P, Kasmo H, Godelaine M, Tilquin F, Dieu M, Renard P, Matroule J-Y
abstract: Copper (Cu) is potentially threatening for living organisms owing to its toxicity at high concentrations, requiring the onset of diverse detoxification strategies to maintain fitness. We previously showed that the environmental conditions modulate the response of the oligotrophic alphaproteobacterium
